intro: Lachnaea pusilla, commonly known as the small lachnaea, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in loose inflorescences. It produces small, dry fruits called capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Lachnaea pusilla is relatively uncommon and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
